channel.title: The languages that separate communities of practice
channel.description:
From Dave Gray's[ Intro to Visual Language](https://www.flickr.com/photos/davegray/albums/72157603989204967):
![](/uploads/default/original/1X/0fd6ec7e0ed7be3ca4fd38a7a05e4b87bbe28aca.jpg)
This is challenge I see us facing over and over in new places with p2p learning, especially where we need to draw in different communities.
I expect a lot of this will be covered in Dave's latest book [Liminal Thinking](http://liminalthinking.com/), and there's a great overview of how jargon languages emerge in different communities of practice, and [how to create pidgin languages to bridge them](http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~afb21/publications/Blackwell_Languages_of_Innovation_preprint.pdf).
